question.text: The Pass Plus Scheme is operated by DVSA for newly qualified drivers. What is it intended to do?

explanation.text: The Pass Plus scheme provides a wide range of driving experience accompanied by a qualified instructor. There is no test and when completed you may get a reduction in insurance costs. It can help to improve basic skills, reduce the risk of having a collision and make you a safer driver.

answer.text: Reduce the cost of your driving licence
Prevent you from paying congestion charges
Allow you to supervise a learner driver
